item.title: Kyran add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "A book must be the axe for the frozen sea within us." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Kyran add a quote by Joan Didion
item.description: "We tell ourselves stories in order to live." -- Joan Didion

item.title: Kyran add a quote by Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
item.description: "Whatever you can do or dream you can, begin it. Boldness has genius, power and magic in it!" -- Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

item.title: Kyran add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "This poetry. I never know what I'm going to say." -- Rumi

item.title: Kyran add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "I didn't come here of my own accord, and I can't leave that way. Whoever brought me here will have to take me home." -- Rumi

item.title: Kyran add a quote by diane von furstenberg
item.description: "Now is the time to become a myth." -- diane von furstenberg

item.title: Kyran add a quote by Anne Morrow Lindbergh
item.description: "The most exhausting thing in life, I have discovered, is being insincere. That is why so much of social life is exhausting; one is wearing a mask. I have shed my mask." -- Anne Morrow Lindbergh

item.title: Kyran add a quote by John Wilmot
item.description: "Before I got married I had six theories about raising children; now, I have six children and no theories." -- John Wilmot

item.title: Kyran add a quote by Diana Athill
item.description: "She was an object lesson on the essential luck, whatever hardships may come their way, of those born able to make things." -- Diana Athill

item.title: Kyran add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description:
"Why, Tom - us people will go on livin' when all them people is gone. Why, Tom, we're the people that live. They ain't gonna wipe us out. Why, we're the people - we go on.'
'We take a beatin' all the time.'
'I know.' Ma chuckled. 'Maybe that makes us tough. Rich fellas come up an' they die, an' their kids ain't no good, an' they die out. But, Tom, we keep a-comin'. Don' you fret none, Tom. A different time's comin'." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Kyran add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "Try to understand men. If you understand each other you will be kind to each other. Knowing a man well never leads to hate and almost always leads to love." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Kyran add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "Socialism never took root in America because the poor see themselves not as an exploited proletariat but as temporarily embarrassed millionaires." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Kyran add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "Hard-covered books break up friendships. You loan a hard covered book to a friend and when he doesnâ€™t return it you get mad at him. It makes you mean and petty. But twenty-five cent books are different." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Kyran add a quote by Bette Midler
item.description: "The worst part of success is trying to find someone who is happy for you." -- Bette Midler

item.title: Kyran add a quote by Marianne Williamson
item.description: "Success means we go to sleep at night knowing that our talents and ablities were used in a way that served others." -- Marianne Williamson

item.title: Kyran add a quote by Marianne Williamson
item.description: "To be a princess is to play at life. To be a queen is to be a serious player...The purpose of life as a woman is to ascend to the throne and rule with heart." -- Marianne Williamson

item.title: Kyran add a quote by Marianne Williamson
item.description:
"...there are four rules for miraculous work creation: Be positive. Send love. Have fun. Kick ass.
Amen." -- Marianne Williamson

item.title: Kyran add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "That country where it is always turning late in the year. That country where the hills are fog and the rivers are mist; where noons go quickly, dusks and twilights linger, and midnights stay. That country composed in the main of cellars, sub-cellars, coal-bins, closets, attics, and pantries faced away from the sun. That country whose people are autumn people, thinking only autumn thoughts. Whose people passing at night on the empty walks sound like rain." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Kyran add a quote by T.H. White
item.description: "The best thing for being sad," replied Merlin, beginning to puff and blow, "is to learn something. That's the only thing that never fails. You may grow old and trembling in your anatomies, you may lie awake at night listening to the disorder of your veins, you may miss your only love, you may see the world about you devastated by evil lunatics, or know your honour trampled in the sewers of baser minds. There is only one thing for it then â€” to learn. Learn why the world wags and what wags it. That is the only thing which the mind can never exhaust, never alienate, never be tortured by, never fear or distrust, and never dream of regretting. Learning is the only thing for you. Look what a lot of things there are to learn." -- T.H. White

item.title: Kyran add a quote by T.H. White
item.description: "She hardly ever thought of him. He had worn a place for himself in some corner of her heart, as a sea shell, always boring against the rock, might do. The making of the place had been her pain. But now the shell was safely in the rock. It was lodged, and ground no longer." -- T.H. White

item.title: Kyran add a quote by T.H. White
item.description: "Now, in their love, which was stronger, there were the seeds of hatred and fear and confusion growing at the same time: for love can exist with hatred, each preying on the other, and this is what gives it its greatest fury." -- T.H. White

item.title: Kyran add a quote by T.H. White
item.description: "There is a thing called knowledge of the world, which people do not have until they are middle-aged. It is something which cannot be taught to younger people, because it is not logical and does not obey laws which are constant. It has no rules. Only, in the long years which bring women to the middle of life, a sense of balance developsâ€¦when she is beginning to hate her used body, she suddenly finds that she can do it. She can go on livingâ€¦ " -- T.H. White
